comments.content:
3) Personal devices can be used with Microsoft Tunnel.

"With Tunnel for MAM, your users can use their own device (BYOD) for both work and personal use, without having to grant the organization's IT department control over that device."

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune-service/protect/microsoft-tunnel-mam#:~:text=With%20Tunnel%20for%20MAM%2C%20your%20users%20can%20use%20their%20own%20device%20(BYOD)%20for%20both%20work%20and%20personal%20use%2C%20without%20having%20to%20grant%20the%20organization%27s%20IT%20department%20control%20over%20that%20device.

2) Company portal and Defender are required for Android devices.

"- Company Portal app (sign-in not required)
 - Defender for Endpoint app"

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune-service/protect/microsoft-tunnel-mam#:~:text=%2D%20Company%20Portal%20app%20(sign%2Din%20not%20required)%0A%0A%2D%20Defender%20for%20Endpoint%20app

Please, follow next comment.

discussion.content:
Given answer is correct.

1) Intune device enrolment is not required for Microsoft Tunnel for MAM.

"Tunnel for MAM extends the Microsoft Tunnel VPN gateway to support devices that run Android or iOS, and that aren't enrolled with Microsoft Intune. With this solution, your users can use a single device that isn't enrolled with Intune to gain secure access to the organizations on-premises apps and resources using modern authentication, single sign-on, and Conditional Access."

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune-service/protect/microsoft-tunnel-mam#:~:text=Tunnel%20for%20MAM%20extends,on%2C%20and%20Conditional%20Access.

Please, follow next comment.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/microsoft-tunnel-mam

Device 1:
- Install Defender for Endpoint app

Requirement for Android 

Device 2:
- Install Edge

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains the devices shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to implement Microsoft Tunnel for Mobile Application Management (MAM) to provide the devices with access to an on-premises web app named App1.

What should you do on each device? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You plan to enroll 25 new devices in Microsoft Intune.

You need to configure an enrollment notification for the new devices.

Which two types of notifications can you use? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
To configure enrollment notifications for new devices in Microsoft Intune, you can use EMAIL notifications and PUSH notifications

Selected Answer: DE
Applies to: Android, iOS/iPadOS, macOS, Windows 10, Windows 11

Set up enrollment notifications in Microsoft Intune to notify employees of newly enrolled devices. Enrollment notifications are sent to assigned users via your selected method: email or push notification. Within a notification, you can:

Add a custom message for the user, with information about how to report an unrecognized device.
Apply your tenant's branding and customization settings (email notifications only).
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/enrollment-notifications

Selected Answer: DE
Check your sandbox lads

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft Entra tenant named contoso.com that contains the users shown in the following table.

//IMG//


For contoso.com, you configure the following Microsoft Entra join and registration settings:

• Users may join devices to Microsoft Entra: Selected
o Selected: Group1

You purchase the devices shown in the following table.

//IMG//


For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Y
Y
N

Admin1 can join Device1 to contoso.com
• Global Admins can always join devices to Microsoft Entra, even if they are not in the selected group.
• Device1 is Windows 11, which supports Microsoft Entra join.
• Answer: Yes

Admin1 can join Device1 to contoso.com.

True. As a Global Administrator, Admin1 has the necessary permissions to join devices to the organization's Microsoft Entra.

User1 can join Device2 to contoso.com.

True. User1 is a member of Group1, which is allowed to join devices to Microsoft Entra. Device2 is a Windows 10 device, so it meets the platform requirement.

User1 can join Device3 to contoso.com.

False. Although User1 is a member of Group1, Device3 is an Android device, which is not specified in the allowed platforms in the given scenario.

N
Y
N
Admin is not in Group1 - NO
User IS in Group1 - Yes
Android can not be Joined. Registered only. NO

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Windows device named Device1.

Device1 was onboarded to Microsoft Defender for Endpoint by using a local script.

You use Microsoft Intune to manage Device1.

You plan to use the machine risk score in a compliance policy.

You need to ensure that the machine risk score is evaluated based on data from Defender for Endpoint.

What should you do? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription and use Microsoft Intune.

You have the Endpoint Privilege Management (EPM) elevation settings policy shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


No EPM elevation rules policies are configured.

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content:
Since there is no EPM elevation rule policy, then there is no elevation information to report.

"Diagnostic data and managed elevations only: The device reports diagnostic data and details about file elevations for only those files that are managed by an elevation rule policy. File requests for unmanaged files, and files that are elevated through the Windows default action of Run as administrator, aren't reported as managed elevations."

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune-service/protect/epm-policies#:~:text=Diagnostic%20data%20and%20managed%20elevations%20only%3A%20The,administrator%2C%20aren%27t%20reported%20as%20managed%20elevations.

discussion.content:
Correct answer:
Be denied.
Only diagnostic data.

"By default, this option isn't configured. If no setting is delivered, the EPM components fall back to their built-in default, which is to deny all requests."

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune-service/protect/epm-policies#:~:text=By%20default%2C%20this%20option%20isn%27t%20configured.%20If%20no%20setting%20is%20delivered%2C%20the%20EPM%20components%20fall%20back%20to%20their%20built%2Din%20default%2C%20which%20is%20to%20deny%20all%20requests.

Please, follow next comment.

comments.content: Regarding the report, it will be Only Diagnostic Data, because there are no elevations due to the previous configuration.
